reviews.review_msg: need an upper division MBB course with no stress? take 342 with jack. nuff said

Professor Brinkman is the nice lady who tries to go through main points. I can see her trying to do better. But, the lecture materials are too content heavy with 76 pages in 1.5hours lecture. I would recommend her to emphasize things are critical rather than dumping too much slides. Hope she slows down since she goes way too fast.

Dr. Brinkman is one of the best profs I've had in MBB. She's very approachable and you can tell she tries her best to ensure the students are doing ok in her class. Her exams are not that hard as long as you reviewed bc everything is on the slide. The lab has step by step instructions that's pretty clear. Lab assignment is also not heavy load

Dr. Brinkman is really a nice and caring person but not good at teaching MBB 342. Perhaps the course is really boring and it is hard for students to memorize all the materials without really experiencing those techniques mentioned.
She seems nice enough but this course is so boring that it is making me rethink my major. Lab assignments are weighted very heavily with minimal guidance from the TA.
Mean, pretentious and unaccommodating. She will refuse to provide a logical reason for an arbitrary decision. If possible, I would pass on her courses.

She is really boring, but the course was also really boring. The grading is really weird because 40% of the grade comes from 56 marks worth of assignments. Of course the TA will not help much if at all. If this was an online course at least the teacher would not make relatively dry material more exhausting to understand. Very distracted in class.

Class was pretty easy, final exam was straightforward, she gives lots of hints over the semester. She cares about students and wants to make material relevant, but sometimes she blitzes over material too fast. Audio notes help. Take assignments seriously cause they're a big part of your grade. Nice lady.

As a whole, I think she is a good prof, and 342 was fairly easy. However, holy slides batman! She throws in like 75+ slides in a 1.5hr lecture, I think the important material could probably be communicated in half that. The course gives a good intro to bioinformatics, but really only scratches the surface.
